metadata.Title: CVE-2020-11538 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
In libImaging/SgiRleDecode.c in Pillow through 7.0.0, a number of out-of-bounds reads exist in the parsing of SGI image files, a different issue than CVE-2020-5311.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-11538` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-pil - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.1
python3-pil.imagetk - 7.0.0-4ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.0-4ubuntu0.1').
pillow-python2 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
